definition: one command brings a hundred responses (idiom); having hundreds of attendants at one's beck and call
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale
variant of 呼[hu1]/to shout/to call out
surname Bai
hundred/numerous/all kinds of
to consent/to promise/(literary) yes!
a hundred answers to a single call (idiom)/to respond en masse
rich and powerful/rich and influential person/big shot
to make a clarion call/to make a public appeal
to exercise sole hegemony (idiom); to dominate a whole area (market, resources etc)/to hold as one's personal fiefdom
to have reached the highest official positions
to fawn on/to kiss up to
to strut about feeling complacent (idiom)
lit. stout horses and light furs/fig. to live in luxury
to order with the chin/to indicate what one wants by facial gesture
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about

aristocracy
golden seal at the waist, purple gown (idiom); in official position
an official (in former times)
extravagant lifestyle
